Class StdPlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • StdPlot
  • public class StdPlot
extends java.lang.Object
    This java file is supposed to easily create fun looking bar charts, line plots with possibility to create regression lines that go along with it and the labelling of axes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.lang.String[] colors
      Array of colors to use (BarChart.java, Kevin Wayne)
      private static boolean isLabeled
      Are the axes are labeled?
      private static double OFFSET
      Offset at which certain lines are drawn
      private static int regLineCount
      Number of regression lines displayed
      private static double SCALE
      Scale of the line drawing graphs
      private static double[] xPoints
      x-points for setting up of label axes to not have it be influenced by regression
      private static double[] yPoints
      y-points for setting up of label axes to not have it be influenced by regression

      • plotRegression

        public static void plotRegression​(double[] x,
                                  double[] y,
                                  int degree,
                                  boolean smoothing)
        Plot regression line of specified x's and y's and specified degrees with a lot of small points, aka smoothing
        Parameters:
        x - array of x-values
        y - array of y-values
        degree - degree of polynomial regression
        smoothing - smooth or not

      • plotBars

        public static void plotBars​(java.lang.String caption,

                            java.lang.String xAxisLabel,
                            java.lang.String[] headers,
                            double[] x)
        Draws bar charts for provided header array and values associated with array (BarChart.java), Kevin Wayne
        Parameters:
        caption - caption string
        title - title string
        xAxisLabel - x-axis label string
        headers - headers string array
        x - array of x-values correlating to headers
